### Question
Chronic urethral obstruction due to benign prismatic hyperplasia can lead to the following change in kidney parenchyma

### Options
A. Hyperplasia
B. Hyperophy
C. Atrophy
D. Dyplasia

Chronic urethral obstruction due to benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) can lead to increased pressure in the urinary tract, which ultimately affects the kidneys. This increased pressure often results in hydronephrosis, causing kidney parenchyma to become thin and reduced in size due to prolonged obstruction. This process leads to **atrophy** of the kidney parenchyma.

### Answer
```C```

### Question
Which vitamin is supplied from only animal source:

### Options
A. Vitamin C
B. Vitamin B7
C. Vitamin B12
D. Vitamin D

Vitamin B12 is primarily obtained from animal sources, as it is not naturally present in plant foods.

### Answer
```C```
